intro: Arabis macrantha, commonly known as the showy rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic four-petaled flowers. The plant is known for its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often covering the rocky substrates where it thrives. Arabis macrantha typically grows to a height of 10-30 cm and has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
